posts.post_content:
[IMG][URL=http://s747.photobucket.com/user/stoogeco/media/IMG_1753.jpg.html][IMG]http://i747.photobucket.com/albums/xx112/stoogeco/IMG_1753.jpg[/IMG][/URL][/IMG]Hello all.

I just purchased a collection (51) of Sweet  Caporal pins.  They are all in very nice condition, no stains or rust, as shown.  There is one large letter Speaker, that has a very interesting red lettered paper back.  It seems that PSA does not differentiate the backs when grading them.  What do you think of the rarity of these?  I can't find much information, just that they are rarer than the normal backs.  Also, what do you think of the value of these?  I'll probably be looking to sell the lot.  The attached are the highest end of the lot.  Thanks as always for the help.  I love this forum!

Dave
[IMG][URL=http://s747.photobucket.com/user/stoogeco/media/IMG_1752.jpg.html][IMG]http://i747.photobucket.com/albums/xx112/stoogeco/IMG_1752.jpg[/IMG][/URL][/IMG]
[IMG][URL=http://s747.photobucket.com/user/stoogeco/media/IMG_1754.jpg.html][IMG]http://i747.photobucket.com/albums/xx112/stoogeco/IMG_1754.jpg[/IMG][/URL][/IMG]
wouldn't happen to have bought these near Harrisburg, PA would've you?
No. Not anywhere close to there.

I've got about 140 of the set.  I have 6-8 of the red backs.  I've never seen any large premium attached to them but they're not common either.  The large letters don't get quite as much respect as they once did and overall the pins aren't as popular as they once were.  There are some of the 'commons' that are very tough to find too.  Non large letters, that is............congrats on the pickup.

Nice P2's! I think this particular raw grouping would be worth between $500-600. My small experience has shown that these pins (HOF'ers) sell faster than you might think. I believe certain condition factors and variations really DO make them that much more attractive and sell quicker. Your pins show some of these attributes - large letters, red backs, centered backs, rust-free. One thing for sure, nice pickup!

Thanks for the input.  

The others are:
Doyle, Warhop, Bell, Doyle LL, Herzog LL, Merkle, Carrigan, Ames, Devlin, Hummel, Bridwell, Murray, Elberfeld, Knight, Quinn, Becker, Engle, McGraw, Tom Jones, Becker, Turner, Engle LL, Engle, Engle, Quinn, Crandall, Rucker LL, Murray, Cicotte, Ford, Ball, Engle, Quinn, Ames, Crandall, Barger, Hooper, Bridwell, Murray, Wiltse, and Wolter.  

I was thinking about $1000 for the whole lot.
Thanks to everyone for the interest and info.  The lot has been sold.
